title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both a correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Disagree. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, the distribution of species will shift towards products when the temperature is decreased in an exothermic reaction. Therefore, the mole fraction of Cl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiBamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@3B91@ will decrease, not increase.

OR

· Agree. Decreasing the temperature of the constant-volume system would decrease the pressure in the container. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, the distribution of species will shift towards the side with the greater number of moles. Therefore, the mole fraction of Cl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiBamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@3B91@ will increase.

The response provides both a correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to one of the following.

· Disagree. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, the distribution of species will shift towards products when the temperature is decreased in an exothermic reaction. Therefore, the mole fraction of Cl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiBamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@3B91@ will decrease, not increase.

OR

· Agree. Decreasing the temperature of the constant-volume system would decrease the pressure in the container. According to Le Châtelier’s principle, the distribution of species will shift towards the side with the greater number of moles. Therefore, the mole fraction of Cl 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGdbGaaeiBamaaBaaaleaacaqGYaaabeaaaaa@3B91@ will increase.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ is more likely to deviate from the ideal gas law. Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ , has dispersion forces only, while COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ has dipole-dipole attractions in addition to stronger dispersion forces than Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ due to a larger and more polarizable electron cloud in COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ . Therefore, COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ has stronger overall intermolecular forces.

The response provides both the correct answer and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ , is more likely to deviate from the ideal gas law. Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ has dispersion forces only, while COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ has dipole-dipole attractions in addition to stronger dispersion forces than Cl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DE7@ due to a larger and more polarizable electron cloud in COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ . Therefore, COCl 2 (g) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F7F@ has stronger overall intermolecular forces.
